contentrichtext.text: [[File:Xavier Fernique.jpg|thumb|220px|Xavier Fernique]] '''Xavier Fernique''' is a [[mathematician]], noted mostly for his contributions to the theory of [[stochastic processes]]. [[Fernique's theorem]], a result on the [[Integrable system|integrability]] of [[Gaussian measure]]s, is named after him. ==External links== * {{mathgenealogy|name=Xavier Fernique|id=74344}} * [http://owpdb.mfo.de/person_detail?id=1097 Photograph], courtesy of the [[Mathematical Research Institute of Oberwolfach]] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Fernique, Xavier | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fernique, Xavier}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:20th-century mathematicians]] [[Category:French statisticians]] {{Statistician-stub}}
